Mythical Maze for Summer Reading Challenge 2014

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Jul 18, 2014

Stuck for reading inspiration over the summer? Try this myths and legends list when you take the Summer Reading Challenge – reserve and collect from your library:

Picture books

  • Sir Scallywag and the Deadly Dragon Poo by Giles Andrea & Korky Paul
  • The Very Messy Mermaid by Tracey Corderoy
  • The Troll by Julia Donaldson
  • The Day Louis Got Eaten by John Fardell
  • How to Catch a Dragon by Caryl Hart
  • Supertato by Sue Hendra
  • Very Little Red Riding Hood by Teresa Heapy
  • Giant by Colin McNaugthon
  • Jack and the Jelly Bean Stalk by Rachael Mortimer
  • The Foggy Foggy Forest by Nick Sharratt
  • Dragon Stew by Steve Smallman
  • Bedtime for Monsters by Ed Vere
  • That’s not my Dragon by Fiona Watt
  • George and the Dragon by Chris Wormell

Beginner reads and short chapter books

  • The Frog Emperor by Anne Adeney
  • The Monster Crisp Guzzler by Malorie Blackman
  • Too Many Webs for Anansi by Malachy Doyle
  • Robin Hood’s Day by Josephine Feeney
  • Cara and the Wizard by Liz Flanagan
  • The Gold-giving Snake by Mick Gowar
  • Benny and the Monster by Sue Graves
  • The Wooden Horse by Russell Punter
  • Big Fright by A B Saddlewick

Junior novels

  • Arrowhead by Ruth Eastham
  • Dragon Shield by Charlie Fletcher
  • Muncle Trogg by Janet Foxley
  • Blackberry Blue by Jamila Gavin
  • Young Knights of the Round Table by Julia Golding
  • Let Sleeping Monsters Lie and Other Cautionary Tales by Eva Ibbotson
  • The Dragonsitter’s Island by Josh Lacey
  • First Aid for Fairies and Other Fabled Beasts by Don Lari
  • Sea Monsters and Other Delicacies by Matthew Morgan
  • The Secret Kingdom by Jenny Nimmo
  • Goblins by Philip Reeve
  • The Sword of Kuhomi by Jason Rohan
  • Really Weird Removals by Daniela Sacerdoti
  • Hagurosan by Darren Shan
  • Muddle Earth by Paul Stewart
  • The Dragon’s Song by Claire Taylor-Smith
  • Fleeced by Julia Wills
  • Emily Feather and the Enchanted Door by Holly Webb

Non–fiction

  • Dr Ernest Drake’s Dragonology: The Complete Book of Dragons by Douglas Steer
  • Beasts and Monsters by Tracey Turner

Jo Dixon

I work for Suffolk Libraries Stock Team.
